post_text:
Are you looking for a school that feels like a family? A place you look forward to everyday because your teachers know you and care about you? How about a school where you can get top-notch, college preparatory education while learning curriculum that includes many cultures and perspective, all while getting the practical skills to make the world a better place? Well Paulo Freire Social Justice Charter School is the place for you!
Paulo Freire Social Justice Charter School serves and provides FREE TRANSPORTATION to students from Holyoke, Chicopee, West Springfield, and South Hadley!
*Apply Now at https://paulofreirecharterschool.org/apply/

Good afternoon,

I know we all just heard about schools being closed for the rest of the year. While I am sure this is hard to hear, please know we have plans to adjust and will take care of ALL our students! Watch your emails and call/contact your advisor for more Info in the coming week.

Love and light.
Joey

post_text: Some more inspiring pictures of our Paideia experiences and displays!
text: Some more inspiring pictures of our Paideia experiences and displays!

post_text: This week we have been doing "Paideia" intersession classes, ranging from Class Conflict Through Film, to Rock Climbing, to Science Adventures. More pictures to come, but here was the first day with the Science Adventures group! Thank you Eagle Eye Institute!
shared_text:
Cassandra Pastorelle
January 22 at 6:06 PM · Instagram ·

We had a great day snowshoeing with @paulofreire_sj at MountainStar Forest on Tuesday, January 21. Students explored the forest in winter and tracked the animals that make it their home: black bear, deer, mouse, gray squirrel, and coyote. Thank you to John Body of @naturenerdsrule for sharing your knowledge and enthusiasm with us, and to @cscottbeach for your support! #winter #exploration #snowshoeing #experiential #learning #tracking #tryityoumightlikeit
text:

post_text:
Dear Parents, Guardians, Families and Friends of PFSJ,

As many of you are already aware, our school called a lockdown this morning around 9:20 AM. This was due to information we received via phone regarding a potential threat against our school. The police investigated the threat and it was determined to NOT be credible. At this point, we lifted the lockdown and we have resumed normal school day activities.

We recognize that this incident caused anxiety and concern among students and staff, and we appreciate everyone's clear and calm response to the events. If any student needs extra support throughout the day or beyond, we have our social worker and other support staff ready to assist. If you have any further questions, please contact the main office.
text:
Dear Parents, Guardians, Families and Friends of PFSJ,

As many of you are already aware, our school called a lockdown this morning around 9:20 AM. This was due to information we received via phone regarding a potential threat against our school. The police investigated the threat and it was determined to NOT be credible. At this point, we lifted the lockdown and we have resumed normal school day activities.

We recognize that this incident caused anxiety and concern among students and staff, and we appreciate everyone's clear and calm response to the events. If any student needs extra support throughout the day or beyond, we have our social worker and other support staff ready to assist. If you have any further questions, please contact the main office.

post_text: So wonderful for our musicians and dancers to be part of this tribute on election day!
shared_text:
Holyoke Media is with Rhonda Soto.
November 5, 2019 at 7:29 PM ·

Today on Election Day, Nov. 5, 2019, more than 100 people gathered at the statue of Sojourner Truth in Florence to celebrate her life and contributions that helped usher in human rights in the United States. Truth fought for ending the enslavement of African Americans and for the rights of women to vote. She lived in Florence from 1843-1857 .
Andrea Ayvazian, founder and director of the Sojourner Truth School, was one of the original organizers that made the memorial. It was unveiled in 2002 at 121 Pine St.
Speakers remembered Truth as a source of inspiration for equality and for people to vote.
The choir of the @paulofreirecharterschool performed Audra Day's "Rise Up." Other Freire students performed a dance.
text:
So wonderful for our musicians and dancers to be part of this tribute on election day!

Holyoke Media is with Rhonda Soto.
November 5, 2019 at 7:29 PM ·

Today on Election Day, Nov. 5, 2019, more than 100 people gathered at the statue of Sojourner Truth in Florence to celebrate her life and contributions that helped usher in human rights in the United States. Truth fought for ending the enslavement of African Americans and for the rights of women to vote. She lived in Florence from 1843-1857 .
Andrea Ayvazian, founder and director of the Sojourner Truth School, was one of the original organizers that made the memorial. It was unveiled in 2002 at 121 Pine St.
Speakers remembered Truth as a source of inspiration for equality and for people to vote.
The choir of the @paulofreirecharterschool performed Audra Day's "Rise Up." Other Freire students performed a dance.

post_text:
Are you looking for a school that feels like a family? A place you look forward to everyday because your teachers know you and care about you? How about a school where you can get top-notch, college preparatory education while learning curriculum that includes many cultures and perspective, all while getting the practical skills to make the world a better place? Well Paulo Freire Social Justice Charter School is the place for you!
Paulo Freire Social Justice Charter School serves and provides FREE TRANSPORTATION to students from Holyoke, Chicopee, West Springfield, and South Hadley!
*Apply Now at https://paulofreirecharterschool.org/apply/

post_text: Wow - what an amazing day yesterday! Over 150 of our scholars and about 40 adults moved almost every piece of furniture out of our two buildings and into the parking lot for our big move to Chicopee! So inspired by our community! (We will continue to occupy 161 Lower Westfield until the end of July, when our offices officially move.)

post_text: Our school enjoyed 3 1/2 days of a "Paideia" intersession last week! "Paideia" is a Greek word that roughly translates as "a broad cultural education," and at PFSJ it means that students can choose from a variety of in-depth courses offered by teachers who have passion and expertise in that area. This year's offerings included both on-campus and off-campus options, such as: Science Field Trips, College Road Trips, Music Writing and Production, Outdoor Winter Survival, Social Justice Films, Drumming and many more! We feel that this opportunity for students to enjoy learning purely for its own sake, and dive deeper into a specific topic, is very much aligned with Paulo Freire's mission and work. Enjoy these pictures of Paideia 2019!
text: Our school enjoyed 3 1/2 days of a "Paideia" intersession last week! "Paideia" is a Greek word that roughly translates as "a broad cultural education," and at PFSJ it means that students can choose from a variety of in-depth courses offered by teachers who have passion and expertise in that area. This year's offerings included both on-campus and off-campus options, such as: Science Field Trips, College Road Trips, Music Writing and Production, Outdoor Winter Survival, Social Justice Films, Drumming and many more! We feel that this opportunity for students to enjoy learning purely for its own sake, and dive deeper into a specific topic, is very much aligned with Paulo Freire's mission and work. Enjoy these pictures of Paideia 2019!

Hi PFSJ Graduates from any year!! We are trying to start an alumni association to keep in touch with you! For starters, there are THREE things we'd like you to do.
1) Fill out the alumni survey at https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdoJ5trKfn4lTgjbHnpc6kSAzd-l09avdcCMcYffdimgHYmrw/viewform
2) Share this and TAG any other alumni/graduates that are your FB friends (and ask them to do the same)
3) Share on other social media like Instagram.

Thank you!

post_text:
Hello PFSJ Families!

Please MARK YOUR CALENDARS!! :

DECEMBER 21- EARLY RELEASE Dismissal 12:30 PM. We are changing this day to an early release to provide staff Professional Development. Enjoy your break!

NOVEMBER 27- VIDEO STREAMLINE TOUR OF OUR POTENTIAL NEW SCHOOL BUILDING! time TBA - We will be doing a streamline video tour of a potential new building for our school! Stay tuned for details; you will be able to tune in from your phone or computer.

On behalf of myself, Dr. Rodriguez, Executive Director, the administrators and the staff, we would like to take this opportunity to thank you for your support and commitment and wish you a wonderful Thanksgiving.

post_text: If you live in Western Massachusetts and are re-thinking (or know someone who is re-thinking their child's current high school) Come check out Paulo Freire Social Justice High School. There are openings in the freshman, sophomore, junior and senior classes! Named one of the top 100 high schools in Massachusetts by US News and World Reports (Bronze Medal Winner), Paulo Freire offers free tuition, books and transportation to Holyoke Community College; exciting internships to explore future careers and a learning community that supports students well beyond graduation! Throw in life changing After school clubs, championship sports teams (Basketball, Volleyball, Soccer, Cross-Country, Baseball, Softball and Track & Field)... this school deserves a special look for that special student in your life. Want more information? IM me or call the school at 413-536-3201. Come join us! If you know a student who needs our community, please share this!

Want more information? IM me or call the school at 413-536-3201. Come join us! If you know a student who needs our community, please share this!

Our doors are open bring your friends and family.

post_text: Tomorrow Thursday, September 20th we commemorate the one year anniversary of Hurricane Maria's devastation of Puerto Rico. We invite the Paulo Freire Social Justice Charter School community, families and students to wear a white shirt or a white ribbon on Thursday 9/20 to show solidarity with Puerto Rico, our affected students and families, and the recovery and rebuilding efforts.
text: Tomorrow Thursday, September 20th we commemorate the one year anniversary of Hurricane Maria's devastation of Puerto Rico. We invite the Paulo Freire Social Justice Charter School community, families and students to wear a white shirt or a white ribbon on Thursday 9/20 to show solidarity with Puerto Rico, our affected students and families, and the recovery and rebuilding efforts.

Want a fresh start to your high school career come to Paulo Freire social justice charter school we are still Taking applications 9-12th grade we will be competing in the MIAA for Athletics we offer varsity girls volleyball , varsity boys basketball Jv boys basketball , varsity girls basketball , varsity softball , varsity baseball the start of a new era for sports at PFSJ also we offer duel enrollment classes at Holyoke Community college meaning your Child could work on getting college credit while still being in high school
